pull.title: [qt] Fix typo and access key in optionsdialog.ui
pull.body: Tooltip displayed ampersand incorrectly, & should be in text property rather than tooltip so that access key is correctly displayed for accessibility.

events.body:
I think the PR description is a little bit misleading because it adds new access keys, right?
Are there no overlapping access keys (haven't checked)?

Binaries: https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/build/229
As part of my utACK I checked that there is no overlap. Even if there was, it would just cycle through (there is already an instance of that with the two `Proxy IP` in the network tab).

utACK f066abd0837df5f4d414d6a092e48f334f9bb864
Please update PR description (it's now part of the git history).

rename.to: [qt] Fix typo and access key in optionsdialog.ui

events.body: I assume &amps will not result in translation string changes?

> I assume &amps will not result in translation string changes?

They do. 
This should go in after 0.15 branch.

Since this touches strings, I think we should merge the fixes, but leave the hotkeys alone/unchanged for now.

Poke me to save affected translations just before merging, so I can restore them after.
@keystrike: can you squash these two commits?
@keystrike  Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits

Typo in optionsdialog.ui

events.message:
Typo in optionsdialog.ui
Tooltip displayed ampersand incorrectly, & should be in text.

events.body: squashed by maintainer due to lack of response.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -199,10 +199,10 @@
        <item>
         <widget class="QCheckBox" name="allowIncoming">
          <property name="toolTip">
-          <string>Accept connections from outside</string>
+          <string>Accept connections from outside.</string>
comments.body: Will this result in a translation string change?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -199,10 +199,10 @@

         <widget class="QCheckBox" name="allowIncoming">
          <property name="toolTip">

+          <string>Accept connections from outside.</string>
          </property>
          <property name="text">

comments.body: This is currently being auto-assigned `L`. I'm not sure `G` is logical enough to warrant a change.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -399,7 +399,7 @@

+          <string>Use separate SOCKS&5 proxy to reach peers via Tor hidden services:</string>
comments.body: This is being auto-assigned `S`. If we change it, `T` seems like a more logical choice...
